attributes.name: Title
attributes.value: Limb bud HCR for Sox9, Hoxa11 and Hoxa13 for "LimbLab: Pipeline for 3D Analysis and Visualisation of Limb Bud Gene Expression"

attributes.name: Description
attributes.value: This dataset accompanies the preprint "LimbLab: Pipeline for 3D Analysis and Visualisation of Limb Bud Gene Expression". It contains 3D lightsheet images of cleared tissue labeled with HCR probes for Sox9, Hoxa11, and Hoxa13.

attributes.name: Acknowledgements
attributes.value:
The authors thank the Mesoscopic Imaging Facility from EMBL
Barcelona for their access to light-sheet microscopy. Specially
to Montserrat Coll-Llado and Jurgen Mayer for the MuViSPIM
training and support. We thank the Animal Facility at PRBB for their support in
animal welfare, maintenance, and services provided.

attributes.name: Title
attributes.value: LimbLab: Pipeline for 3D Analysis and Visualisation of Limb Bud Gene Expression

attributes.name: Agency
attributes.value: Ministerio de Ciencia, Innovacion y Universidades

attributes.name: Sample preparation protocol
attributes.value:
In order to perform the HCR, we followed the protocol exactly
as described in Angela Morabito et al. Optimized
protocol for whole-mount rna fluorescent in situ hybridization
using oxidation-mediated autofluorescence reduction on mouse
embryos. STAR Protocols, 4(4):102603, December 2023..

In summary, HCR procotol consists of
several steps: fixation, photcochemical bleaching, detection,
and amplification of HCR™RNA-FISH, clearing, and sample
preparation.

Sample Preparation
After clearing samples with Fructose-Glycerol solution for a couple
of days, samples were embedded in 1% low melting agarose in 10
mM Tris pH 7.4. The agarose gel containing the sample was then
cut into octagonal prism shapes of approximately 1 cm3 and placed
on a 24 well plate with fructose-glycerol clearing solution in order
to clear the agarose. This is incubated for a minimum of 24 hours
at room temperature protected from light.

attributes.name: Image acquisition parameters
attributes.value:
Light sheet imaging was performed using MuViSPIM from
Luxendo. Dual side illumination was performed with the
illumination objectives Nikon CFI Plan Apo Lambda 4× and collar
was adjusted to 1.47, matching the refractive index from GlycerolFructose clearing solution. Fluorescence was then captured with
immersion 10X Refractive Index adjustment 1.33-1.51 0.5NA glyc
WD 5.5 objective. The block of agarose containing the sample was
attached to a 3D printed holder and afterwards was immersed in
the cuvette containing Fructose-Glycerol clearing solution.

attributes.name: Description
attributes.value: HCR multi channel volume (Sox9, Hoxa11, Hoxa13 and control channels)
